p: Mice were scored daily for 10 days based on body weight and stool formation (bloody or nonbloody). Stool formation, bloody stool scores, and weight loss were averaged to determine the Disease Activity Index (DAI). Scores were assessed as follows: bloody stools (0: negative, 2: positive, or 4: gross bleeding), weight change (0: <1%, 1: 1–5%, 2: 5–10%, 3: 10–15%, or 4: >15%), and stool formation (0: normal, 2: loose stools, or 4: diarrhea). On day 10, the mice were sacrificed under ether vapor anesthesia and the intestines were isolated [ 28].
